intro: Gymnanthelia commutata, commonly known as the roughleaf gymnanthelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often rough to the touch. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a distinctive scent that attracts pollinators. Gymnanthelia commutata is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
